definition[0]: to use rude and offensive language
example[0]: Don’t swear in front of the children.
example[1]: He turned round and swore at me.
definition[1]: to promise that you will do something
example[2]: Do you swear on your honour (=promise very strongly) that you will never tell anyone?
example[3]: Victor swore he would get his revenge.
example[4]: Mona swore never to return home.
definition[2]: to say very strongly that what you are saying is true
example[5]: I never touched your purse, I swear!
example[6]: I never touched her, I swear to God.
example[7]: I think it was about ten o'clock when we left, but I couldn’t swear to it (=I am not certain).
example[8]: She swore blind that she had never seen him before.
example[9]: He says he was there all the time, but I swear I never saw him.
definition[3]: to make a public official promise, especially in a court of law
example[10]: Remember that you have sworn an oath and so must tell the truth.
example[11]: Presidents must swear allegiance to the US constitution.
example[12]: Witnesses have to swear on the Bible.
